title: Firehouse Cheeseburgers
directions: In a small bowl, combine sour cream, ranch dressing, and remaining garlic powder. Season with salt and pepper.
In a large bowl, combine beef, frank's RedHot Original Seasoning, a dash of hot sauce, and salt. Form into two patties. Each slightly wider than a burger bun.
Heat a large drizzle of olive oil in a large pan over medium heat. Add patties and cook until browned and cooked to desired doneness, 3 - 5 minutes per side.
In the last 1 - 2 minutes of cooking, top each patty with Monterey Jack. Cover pan to melt cheese.
While patties cook, halve and toast buns. Spread cut sides of buns with creamy ranch sauce, then fill with patties and top with crispy fried onions.
